meanings.sent1: The antitrade policy led to higher prices for imported goods.
meanings.sent2: Her antitrade views made her hesitant to support international agreements.
meanings.sent3: The antitrade stance of the company seemed to go against common sense.
meanings.sent4: His antitrade beliefs were like a wall blocking economic progress.
meanings.sent5: The impact of the antitrade decision was felt across the market.

meanings.definition: A person or group that is against trade.
meanings.sent1: The antitrade was vocal about the negative effects of globalization.
meanings.sent2: She joined the antitrade organization to advocate for local businesses.
meanings.sent3: The antitrade at the meeting raised some interesting points about tariffs.
meanings.sent4: He saw himself as a warrior fighting for the rights of antitrades everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The group of antitrades gathered to protest the new trade agreement.
